lead_paragraph: BERNSTEIN--Jeffrey M.,55, passed away at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital on Wednesday, January 27, after a battle with lymphoma. Jeff was born in Englewood, New Jersey to Cynthia and the late Leopold Bernstein. He graduated from the Center for Open Education in 1978 and from American University in 1982. Jeff had a long career in the music industry as a producer, composer and writer, known for composing the theme song for the PBS show, "Postcards from Buster." Jeff also played the upright bass, the guitar and African drums. Jeff will be remembered for his humor, wit, passion, intellect, kindness and generosity. He made friends wherever he went. Jeff is survived by his loving wife, Shonda, his son, Noble Archer, three, residing together in New York City, his mother Cynthia, residing in Haworth, NJ, and his sister Debbie, residing with her husband, Paul, in Doylestown, PA. He will be missed by his nieces, Jennifer and Stephanie. A memorial service will be held at the Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY at 2:00pm on Sunday, January 31. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in Jeffrey's memory to the Center for Advancement in Cancer Education, 130 Almshouse Road, Suite 107A, Richboro, PA 18954, www.beatcancer.org. 1/3
